text: Prelude in C (Bach) can refer to one of several compositions by Johann Sebastian Bach: * Prelude in C major, BWV 846, from the Prelude and Fugue in C major, BWV 846, from Book I of The Well-Tempered Clavier ** Ave Maria (Bach/Gounod) a popular setting of the Latin text Ave Maria, composed by Charles Gounod to be superimposed over Bach's Prelude in C major, BWV 846 * Prelude in C minor, BWV 847, from the Prelude and Fugue in C minor, BWV 847, from Book I of The Well-Tempered Clavier * Prelude in C minor, BWV 871, from the Prelude and Fugue in C minor, BWV 871, from Book II of The Well-Tempered Clavier * Prelude in C minor, BWV 934, from the Six Little Preludes, BWV 933–938 * Prelude in C minor, BWV 999, for solo lute == See also == * Prelude in C (disambiguation)
title: Prelude in C (Bach)
